009
010package imagingbook.lib.image;
011
012
013/**
014 * This class implements different schemes for accessing pixel values from
015 * a 2D image that is contained in a 1D array.
016 * The key method {@link #getIndex(int, int)} returns the 1D array index
017 * for a pair of image coordinates. 
018 */
019public abstract class PixelIndexer {
020        
021        public static PixelIndexer create(int width, int height, OutOfBoundsStrategy mode) {
022                switch (mode) {
023                case DefaultValue       : return new DefaultValueIndexer(width, height);
024                case NearestBorder      : return new NearestBorderIndexer(width, height);
025                case MirrorImage        : return new MirrorImageIndexer(width, height);
026                case Exception          : return new ExceptionIndexer(width, height);
027                }
028                return null;
029        }
030        
031        protected final int width;
032        protected final int height;
033
034        private PixelIndexer(int width, int height) {
035                this.width = width;
036                this.height = height;
037        }
038        
039        /**
040         * Returns the 1D array index for a given pair of image coordinates. 
041         * @param u x-coordinate
042         * @param v y-coordinate
043         * @return 1D array index
044         */
045        public abstract int getIndex(int u, int v);
046        
047        private int defaultIndex(int u, int v) {
048                return width * v + u;
049        }
050        
051        // ---------------------------------------------------------
052
053        /** 
054         * This indexer returns out of bounds pixel values that
055         * are taken from the closest border pixel. This is the
056         * most common method.
057         */
058        public static class NearestBorderIndexer extends PixelIndexer {
059                
060                NearestBorderIndexer(int width, int height) {
061                        super(width, height);
062                }
063
064                @Override
065                public int getIndex(int u, int v) {
066                        if (u < 0) {
067                                u = 0;
068                        }
069                        else if (u >= width) {
070                                u = width - 1;
071                        }
072                        if (v < 0) {
073                                v = 0;
074                        }
075                        else if (v >= height) {
076                                v = height - 1;
077                        }
078                        return super.defaultIndex(u, v);
079                }
080        }
081        
082        /** 
083         * This index returns out of bound pixels taken from
084         * the mirrored image.
085         */
086        public static class MirrorImageIndexer extends PixelIndexer {
087                
088                MirrorImageIndexer(int width, int height) {
089                        super(width, height);
090                }
091
092                @Override
093                public int getIndex(int u, int v) {
094                        // fast modulo operation for positive divisors only
095                        u = u % width;
096                        if (u < 0) {
097                                u = u + width; 
098                        }
099                        v = v % height;
100                        if (v < 0) {
101                                v = v + height; 
102                        }
103                        return super.defaultIndex(u, v);
104                }
105        }
106        
107        /** 
108         * This indexer returns -1 for out of bounds pixels to
109         * indicate that a (predefined) default value should be used.
110         */
111        public static class DefaultValueIndexer extends PixelIndexer {
112                
113                DefaultValueIndexer(int width, int height) {
114                        super(width, height);
115                }
116
117                @Override
118                public int getIndex(int u, int v) {
119                        if (u < 0 || u >= width || v < 0 || v >= height) {
120                                return -1;
121                        }
122                        else {
123                                return super.defaultIndex(u, v);
124                        }
125                }
126        }
127        
128        /**
129         * This indexer throws an exception if out of bounds pixels
130         * are accessed.
131         */
132        public static class ExceptionIndexer extends PixelIndexer {
133                
134                ExceptionIndexer(int width, int height) {
135                        super(width, height);
136                }
137
138                @Override
139                public int getIndex(int u, int v) {
140                        if (u < 0 || u >= width || v < 0 || v >= height) {
141                                throw new ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException();
142                        }
143                        else 
144                                return super.defaultIndex(u, v);
145                }
146        }
147
148}
149
150
